title: 1486-B
statement: B. Eastern Exhibitiontime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou and your friends live in $$$n$$$ houses. Each house is located on a 2D plane, in a point with integer coordinates. There might be different houses located in the same point. The mayor of the city is asking you for places for the building of the Eastern exhibition. You have to find the number of places (points with integer coordinates), so that the summary distance from all the houses to the exhibition is minimal. The exhibition can be built in the same point as some house. The distance between two points $$$(x_1, y_1)$$$ and $$$(x_2, y_2)$$$ is $$$|x_1 - x_2| + |y_1 - y_2|$$$, where $$$|x|$$$ is the absolute value of $$$x$$$.InputFirst line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ $$$(1 \\leq t \\leq 1000)$$$ — the number of test cases.The first line of each test case contains a single integer $$$n$$$ $$$(1 \\leq n \\leq 1000)$$$. Next $$$n$$$ lines describe the positions of the houses $$$(x_i, y_i)$$$ $$$(0 \\leq x_i, y_i \\leq 10^9)$$$.It's guaranteed that the sum of all $$$n$$$ does not exceed $$$1000$$$.OutputFor each test case output a single integer - the number of different positions for the exhibition. The exhibition can be built in the same point as some house.ExampleInput6 3 0 0 2 0 1 2 4 1 0 0 2 2 3 3 1 4 0 0 0 1 1 0 1 1 2 0 0 1 1 2 0 0 2 0 2 0 0 0 0Output1 4 4 4 3 1NoteHere are the images for the example test cases. Blue dots stand for the houses, green — possible positions for the exhibition.First test case.Second test case.Third test case.Fourth test case.Fifth test case.Sixth test case. You are given a set of houses located at points with integer coordinates on a 2D plane.  Some houses may share the same coordinates.  You need to find the location (a point with integer coordinates) to build an exhibition so that the total distance from all houses to the exhibition is minimized. The distance between two points $(x_1, y_1)$ and $(x_2, y_2)$ is  $|x_1 - x_2| + |y_1 - y_2|$.  

The exhibition can be built at the same location as one of the houses.

Input:

* The first line contains the number of test cases, *t* (1 ≤ *t* ≤ 1000).
* For each test case:
    * The first line contains the number of houses, *n* (1 ≤ *n* ≤ 1000).
    * The next *n* lines describe the coordinates of each house, $(x_i, y_i)$ (0 ≤ *x_i*, *y_i* ≤ 10^9).

Output:

For each test case, output a single integer representing the number of possible locations for the exhibition.

You are given a set of points representing houses. Find the point that minimizes the total distance to all houses, where distance is calculated as the sum of the absolute differences in x and y coordinates.
